Class CinnaMoney 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----CinnaMoney
public class CinnaMoney
extends Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.Nutmeg.Sortable
CinnaMoney class (Arbitrary Precision Math class, designed for Money and other manipulation where precision is essential).

A class to manage binary coded numbers with accuracy.

int the number of fractional digits
setPrecision 
  protected void setPrecision(int anInt)
Internal - Sets the precision to the value of anInt parameter. The numeric String is NOT changed by this operation - the decimal point is only shifted! This is used internally to managed setting precision.
Parameters:
anInt - The precision to set the CinnaMoney class to.
Throws: RuntimeException
if anInt < 0 or > size() of CinnaMoney's digits
setSign 
  public void setSign(boolean isPositive)
Set whether the sign is positive or not.
Parameters:
isPositive - value will be true if CinnaMoney is a positive value, and false if it's negative.
round 
  public void round(int anInt)
Change the precision of a number, modifying it's number of digits if necessary to do the adjustment. If precision is reduced, the Number is shortened (rounding data!), if the precision is increased, the Number is lengthened by adding 0's to the end of the value
Parameters:
anInt - The new precision to which the CinnaMoney value is to be rounded.
trunc 
  public void trunc(int anInt)
Change the precision of a number, modifying it's number of digits if necessary to do the adjustment. If precision is reduced, the Number is truncated (losing precision!), if the precision is increased, the Number is lengthed by adding 0's to the end of the value
Parameters:
anInt - The new precision to which the CinnaMoney value is to be truncated.
changePrecision 
  public void changePrecision(int anInt)
Change the precision of a number, modifying it's number of digits if necessary to do the adjustment. If precision is reduced, the Number is shortened (losing data!), if the precision is increased, the Number is lengthed by adding 0's to the end of the value. This Method call is currently identical in function to a trunc, but is provided so that calling code can appear clearer when precision is 'increased' instead of 'decreased' (which is the association with round and trunc). The method can be used interchangeably with trunc however.
Parameters:
anInt - The new precision to which the CinnaMoney value is to be set to.

multiply 
  public CinnaMoney multiply(CinnaMoney aCinnaMoney)
Multiply another CinnaMoney object with this one and return a new CinnaMoney Object containing the results of the operation.
Parameters:
aCinnaMoney - the other CinnaMoney object to be multiplied to this one.
Returns:
CinnaMoney the resultant value - it's precision becomes the sum of the two precisions to be multiplied.
divide 
  public CinnaMoney divide(CinnaMoney aCinnaMoney)
Divide another CinnaMoney object into this one and return a new CinnaMoney Object as containing the results of the operation. Results have 4 times the precision as the greatest precision of the two numbers to be multiplied. The results are also truncated and not rounded past the last precision visible.
Parameters:
aCinnaMoney - the other CinnaMoney object this one is to be divided by.
Returns:
CinnaMoney the resultant value
compare 
  public int compare(Object aCinnaMoney)
Implemented to comply with interface Sortable for Nutmeg(tm) interoperability.
Parameters:
aCinnaMoney - The CinnaMoney Object to compare with.
Returns:
int Returns 0 if equal, -1 if less than, 1 if greater than.
